intro: Anthistiria basisericea, commonly known as the silverleaf daisy, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is characterized by its silvery-gray leaves and bright yellow daisy-like flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky soils and is adapted to arid environments. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes many other flowering plants with composite flower heads. Anthistiria basisericea is often used in xeriscaping due to its low water requirements and ornamental value.
